summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 29, 2020, discussing a request for agent assistance from Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The emails show coordination between agents and supervisors regarding time commitments and availability for evidence processing and discovery preparation.

persons.name: Him (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, responding to a request for assistance on the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, discussing project timelines and evidence volume.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: A Supervisory Special Agent from the FBI New York Office, Public Corruption unit, inquiring about the time commitment for the assistance request.

persons.name: SAM
persons.context: An FBI agent who indicates willingness to assist with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation pending supervisor approval.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in coordinating assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, with SA being a point of contact.
SAM seeks the Supervisory Special Agent's approval to assist with the investigation, indicating a chain of command relationship.
Both are FBI personnel in the New York Office discussing resource allocation for the high-profile case.

events.title: FBI Assistance Request for Epstein/Maxwell Investigation
events.description: Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) circulates an internal request for FBI agent assistance related to the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, citing a unique opportunity and high profile.

events.title: Discovery Preparation Deadline
events.description: The FBI is working on projects in preparation for discovery, with one project having a turnaround time by the end of August 2020.

keyFacts: The FBI's Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT - Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) was actively seeking agent assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The investigation involved a 'large volume of evidence' that required significant time to process, indicating the scale of the case.
The request highlights internal FBI coordination and resource allocation challenges for high-profile cases, with agents balancing squad duties.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing investigative activity and discovery preparation nearly a year after Epstein's death in August 2019.
